Brun Chief Operating Officer Director of Membership tbrun@thelegendclubs.com Sue Prei Director of Accounting sprei@thelegendclubs.com David Bobber Director of Golf dbobber@thelegendclubs.com Multi-Club Management Jamie Sandin Director of Event Sales jsandin@thelegendclubs.com Judy Navarro IT Director jnavarro@thelegendclubs.com TJ Boinski Membership Sales Associate tboinski@thelegendclubs.com Maxx McGinnis Media Specialist mmcginnis@thelegendclubs.com Crystal Stutz Accounts Payable ap@thelegendclubs.com Jake Szaniawski Administrative Assistant jszaniawski@thelegendclubs.com The Legend at Brandybrook Managers Josh Minsky Head Golf Professional jminsky@thelegendclubs.com Jake Renner Golf Course Superintendent jrenner@thelegendclubs.com Keith Foster, C.S.C. Executive Chef kfoster@thelegendclubs.com Jackie Fellin Clubhouse Manager jfellin@thelegendclubs.com Ryan Kratky Service Manager rkratky@thelegendclubs.com The Legend at Merrill Hills Managers Alex Johansen Head Golf Professional ajohansen@thelegendclubs.com Randy VanFleet Golf Course Superintendent rvanfleet@thelegendclubs.com Jason Herbrand Executive Chef jherbrand@thelegendclubs.com Marty Hersh Clubhouse Manager mhersh@thelegendclubs.com Jessica Gault Service Manager jgault@thelegendclubs.com The Legend at Bristlecone Managers Nathan Goecks Head Golf Professional ngoecks@thelegendclubs.com Mark Robel Golf Course Superintendent mrobel@thelegendclubs.com Clayton Cass Executive Chef ccass@thelegendclubs.com George Renner Clubhouse Manager grenner@thelegendclubs.com Megan Haynes Service Manager mhaynes@thelegendclubs.com Brett Phalen Service Manager bphalen@thelegendclubs.com The Legend at Bergamont Managers Brad Petashnick Head Golf Professional & Membership Director bpetashnick@thelegendclubs.com Jered Kamin Golf Course Superintendent jkamin@thelegendatbergamont.com Joe Learned Executive Chef jlearned@thelegendatbergamont.com Megan Torok Membership Sales Associate mtorok@thelegendatbergamont.com Melissa Wooten Event Sales Manager mwooten@thelegendatbergamont.com Join Today! Click to schedule a tour. "The finest clubs, like family traditions, trace their roots to strong contributions by individuals. These individuals create the environment in which camaraderie flourishes and new friendships begin. These individuals are called Members.” LIVE THE LEGEND! For membership information, call Chief Operating Officer & Director of Membership, Tom Brun at 262-968-9717. © Copyright 2025. All rights reserved. The Golf Club at Magnolia Landing, Fort Myers, FL - Albrecht Golf Guide Golf Courses Golf Hotels Golf Packages Bookshop Apps Sign in / Sign up Saved Items Deutsch English Español Italiano Albrecht Golf Guide Golf courses in North America United States Florida The Golf Club at Magnolia Landing 18 Hole Public Overview Course Visitors Prices Amenities Reviews No image available The Golf Club at Magnolia Landing 3501 Avenida del Vera, Fort Myers, FL 33917-8120, USA Phone: +1 239-652-0102 , Fax: +1 239-652-6676 www.magnolialandingclub.com Map Save Share 4.5 of 5 stars 15 Reviews The Course 18-Hole Course Driving Range  &  Practice area Visitors welcome? Yes - every day. Season: Year round Green fees $70 (60 €) / 18 Holes The Course 18-Hole Course Opened in 2007. Design: Gordon Lewis . Terrain: Water hazards Technical difficulty: Moderate - Hard Scorecard Tee Par CR Slope Length Black (Men) 72 75.4 142 7265 yards Gold (Men) 72 73 133 6769 yards Green (Men) 72 69.4 119 6140 yards White (Women) 72 71.9 126 5441 yards Red (Women) 72 68.1 119 4690 yards Practice Facilities Driving Range Putting Green Chipping Green Visitors 18-Hole Course Visitors are welcome every day. Green Fees 18-Hole Course Green Fee Mon - Fri Sat, Sun, Holidays 18 Holes $70 (60 €) $70 (60 €) Amenities Club Amenities Bar Rentals Clubs for hire Electro-cart for hire Enlarge / get directions Nearby Courses Herons Glen G&CC North Fort Myers (2.2 km) 4.0 of 5 stars (9) 18 Hole 68 € / 18 Holes Lake Fairways Country Club Fort Myers (3.3 km) 18 Hole Pine Lakes Country Club Fort Myers (3.5 km) 2.0 of 5 stars (1) 18 Hole See all User Reviews 4.5 of 5 stars 15 Reviews 5 Stars: 7 4 Stars: 8 3 Stars: 0 2 Stars: 0 1 star: 0 Write a Review Most Recent Reviews Harry W 78 Reviews Automatic translation Original version Beautiful, difficult, long 4.0 of 5 stars Reviewed January 17, 2024 Beautiful, very well-kept place. You should play. Translated by Google . Hampe 61 167 Reviews Automatic translation Original version Difficult 4.0 of 5 stars Reviewed January 26, 2019 I played the course four times today. Very difficult, practically with all holes flanking water, and in addition many bunker. As if that were not enough, there are still hanging greens, which together with the fast Floridagreens usually results in a 3-putt! If you let the view wander a bit off the fairways, you feel like you're in the middle of the jungle; something else. All in all: Should visit during a stay in Florida. Translated by Google . pitchmark 388 Reviews Automatic translation Original version Lots of water and very spacious 4.0 of 5 stars Reviewed April 29, 2018 Flanking or frontal water on 16 holes available, which is now and then in the game. A really modern Florida course. He is one of the best public places around Fort Myers - for us the best. But he is very demanding if you want to play his score - all par 3 have more than 190 yards, 4 par 4 over 400 and 2 par 5 over 600. Slope 145 / Rating75.4 says a lot. Solid straight punches, sometimes courageous ones are mandatory. And he second in the green must also fit. In addition, some green forms are almost mean. Flat to slightly undulating fairways await the player. They had a lot of fun today, the balls rolled. The bunkers serve here more the stray balls to the strategy. The greens are usually quite large, some well defended. Others do not need any, they are very narrow and very long or very wide with very little depth. That makes the attacking extremely difficult. You have to read them very well, because they have very nice breaks. They were excellent to play today, tough and very fast. They ruined our score today. Excellent maintained facility - big compliment. Two years ago, the order of the holes was changed to the first nine, which has a very positive effect on the flow of the game. Unfortunately, the course has lost some of its charm. Part of the forests - spruces - which accompany the holes were felled, created a huge construction site. Houses are built. A good, nice - especially the locker, really English. Very nice staff. It's always fun to play here, he's on the list almost every year. Not all were for 5 stars, the construction sites because there are only 4. Translated by Google . Been to The Golf Club at Magnolia Landing ? Share your experiences! Instagram ASB Lorena Dayton Anne Fumelle Tristhan Lim, ASB President dayton_l@auhsd.us Students run for elected office or apply for appointed office in February 2022 for the 2022-2023 school year. @magnolia_asb Academic Decathlon Virginia Kim Adult Transition Club Erin McCown/ Amber Zisko Lucila Brito mccown_e@auhsd.us/zisko_a@auhsd.us Students apply and interview Agriculture Club Anne Fumelle Misa Nguyen 1059033@student.auhsd.us mackprang_e@auhsd.us fumelle_a@auhsd.us Email Anne Fumelle or Emily Mackprang @mag_ag_club Athletics Directors Anne Fumelle, Angelita White AUsome Sents Janelle Oquendo Baile Folklorico Berta Jimenez Aileen Ramirez-Ruiz 1056464@student.auhsd.us Baseball Bill McFeggan bill@fairweatherroofing.net email Basketball - Girls Xavier Barnett Teresa Martinez- Perez Barnett_x@auhsd.us email/tryouts @magnoliagbb Basketball – Boys Damian Tello tello_d@auhsd.us email/tryouts Black Student Union Damian Tello tello_d@auhsd.us email Book and Poetry Club Janene Morgan Sirajam Munira, 1040929@student.auhsd.us morgan_j@auhsd.us All students are welcome to join Book Club and attend lunch time meetings. @magnoliabookclub California Scholarship Federation Margaret Tagler Melanie Lopez tagler_m@auhsd.us 10th/11th/12th grade students apply every semester with an approximate 3.5 GPA Choral Music Alan Garcia Steven Tong & Yazmin Cervantes garcia_al@auhsd.us All students are welcome to join Choir by selecting it as an elective for the upcoming year. Chamber Singers and Vocal Harmonia are audition only and are held in late January! @magnoliachoir Class of 2023 Carrie Saleman Monty Aljadeed saleman_c@auhsd.us Any Senior student can join and attend lunchtime meetings. @magnoliahs2023 Class of 2024 Kalli Pappas and co/advisor Julie Carrillo Daniel Santana Any Junior student can join and attend lunchtime meetings. @magnoliahs2024 Class of 2025 Sheri Rothwell Amanda Robles rothwell_s@auhsd.us Any Sophomore student can join and attend lunchtime meetings. Class of 2026 Darlene Phaxayaseng Cross Country Erland Jones jones_erl@auhsd.us All Students are welcome. While attending college at Sam Houston in 2011, he went on a 3 month internship at Council Fire Golf Club in Chattanooga, Tennessee where he worked as an outside services staff member. Garrett enjoys playing golf with the members, working on golf events and with students and juniors on their golf game. OK Skip to Content Opens in new tab Member Login Benefits Finder Opens in new tab Careers Magnolia Creek Golf Club Main Site Navigation Who We Are Golf Dining Membership Host An Event Join Now Host Event Login - Opens in new tab Menu Who We Are Our Team Directions & Hours Calendar Golf Ireland Course Scotland Course England Course Dining Membership Host An Event Events Meetings & Corporate Tournaments & Outings Contact Us Opens in new tab Member Login Benefits Finder Opens in new tab Careers Home Tee up, Texas Located in League City, Tx, Magnolia Creek offers a 27-hole links-style course that invites golfers to step back in time and experience rolling hills, deep, entrenched bunkers, and native grasses similar to legendary courses. With spacious fairways, numerous bunkers and a world-class 22-acre practice facility, Magnolia Creek is an authentic golf experience. Open "Dining" Card Content Dining Raise A Glass Dining The Grille at Magnolia Creek Golf Club offers a variety of items to suit any golfer’s palate. The Lone Pine Grill is open every day. Stop by for one of the famous hamburgers or a pint of Irish ale after your round. Explore Dining Open "Golf" Card Content Golf Tee Up, Texas Golf Magnolia Creek Golf Club features a 27-hole links-style course, which offers up an unrivaled golfing experience in the Houston area. Explore Golf Skip Image Carousel Open "Social Life" Card Content Social Life Find Your Community Social Life With a bustling social schedule, leagues and tournaments for golfers of all skill levels and year-round opportunities for the whole family, Magnolia Creek Golf Club offers something for every interest. Explore Life at the Club Open "Host An Event" Card Content Host An Event Start Planning Your Event Host An Event As League City’s premier club, we host exceptional parties, from charity golf tournaments and outdoor celebrations under the stars to elegant meals held in intimate dining rooms. Magnolia Management Services Home About Us About Us Contact Us Services Request a Proposal Owner Portals Make A Payment More Home About Us About Us Contact Us Services Request a Proposal Owner Portals Make A Payment Home About Us About Us Contact Us Services Request a Proposal Owner Portals Make A Payment History In June of 2013, Daniel Camp and Tylor Hansen started Pelican Association Management with a vision to create  a management company where customer service is the primary focus. Renamed Magnolia Management Services in 2018, our team still strives every single day to live out that original vision. Meet the Team Daniel Camp, CMCA Daniel started in the HOA management industry in 2008 while working two other jobs (one as a volunteer high school football coach) and attending Louisiana State University. Upon graduating with a Bachelor of Arts in History Secondary Education in 2010, Daniel decided that he would be more suited for the management business than as a football coach and teacher.  The desire to start a business of his own finally came true in June of 2013. Since then, Daniel has strived every day to build a team and company that lives up to that original vision. He achieved his CMCA credential in May of 2013. She also has a strong background in marketing, social media and web design. As a mother of two boys, Sarah understands the importance of balance and effective communication.
